Varanasi Tour Packages

One of the seven holiest cities in India, Varanasi is also reckoned as the spiritual capital of India Read More

and welcomes millions of tourists flock to this city from all around the globe. Devotees come to this holy place and take a dip in the holy River Ganges and also to perform various rituals along the riverbank. Through its centuries-long history, Varanasi has been called by different names viz. Kashi, Varanasi, Benaras, and Banaras and is more remarkable for its ancient way of living. There is a strong belief among Hindu devout that taking a dip into the River Ganges washes away all your sins and makes you free from all the committed sins.

The city houses almost more than 2000 temple amongst which Kashi Vishwanath Temple which is also called as Golden Temple is the most popular pilgrimage in this ancient city. Visiting this holy city makes you feel like your soul has found a permanent place in paradise. Are you also thinking of a Varanasi tour as your next trip? If yes, then Namaste India Trip is the most appropriate choice for you. We offer you some of the most customizable Varanasi Tour Packages which are designed for every kind of traveler coming from various corners of the country and foreign. The packages are designed after considering the biggest parameters of a traveling i.e. time constraint and budget and so one can find budget-friendly Varanasi Tour Packages.

The itinerary of our packages are designed as per the travel preference of the travelers like if you are traveling to Varanasi for attaining spiritual experiences then you can opt for our Varanasi holy city tour package and if you are a history buff then you can select the itinerary which includes exploring the museums and historical monuments standing beautifully in this ancient city. However, there is one thing very common in all the packages that the services we offer to our clients are far beyond their expectations. All our customized tour packages offer you the opportunity of shopping in the city which includes shopping out the religious items, handicrafts, handlooms, leather goods, etc. How can we even ignore talking about the Banarasi Silk Emporium for which the city had gained worldwide fame?

Kashi Tour Packages are included of all the interesting and enriching places like cultural places, religious places, historical places, and the surreal scenic vistas like Lakes and the beautiful and colorful gardens. On your visit to museums in the city, you get the chance to explore the vast collection of antiques and ruins left inside. You are going to be surely amazed by the beauties of the collections kept inside the museum. Similarly, on your visit to historical monuments, you will be mesmerized with the intricate carvings and paintings adorning them. One also gets to know about the kings who ruled in the city and took control over it. You will also come to know about the battle they played and the result. So, what are you waiting for?

Allahabad Varanasi Puri Tour Package 07 Nights / 08 Days INR 38,500

Varanasi - The City of Lights

Located on the banks of the River Ganges in Uttar Pradesh, Varanasi is a holy city believed to be the abode of Lord Shiva. Varanasi, which gets its name from two rivers Varuna and Assi, is among the oldest living cities in the world. The legendary place is a famous pilgrimage centre for Hindus and equally revered for Buddhist and Jain followers. Varanasi is the place where Parshwanath, the 23rd Jain Tirthankar, was born and Lord Buddha after attaining enlightenment in Sarnath preached his first sermon. Famed for its various ancient temples and beautiful Ghats, Varanasi is an ideal place for spiritual purification.

Dedicated to Lord Shiva, the Kashi Vishwanath Temple is one of the most sacred temples in India. The temple is famous for housing one of the 12 Jyotirlingas of Lord Shiva. Often referred as ‘Golden Temple’, the temple was rebuilt by Maharani Ahilya Bai Holkar of Indore in the 18th century. Tulsi Manas Temple, Durga Temple and Bharat Mata Temple are other famous temples in Varanasi.

The vibrant Ghats of Varanasi are a delight to explore. There are nearly 100 Ghats in Varanasi. Out of them Assi Ghat, Dashashwamedh Ghat, Manikarnika Ghat and Panchganga Ghat are the most famous and oldest ones. Spending an evening at Dashashwamedh Ghat taking part in the aarti is surely going to be a quintessential experience. Moreover, a boat ride along the River Ganges praising the beauty of the Ghat is quite a wonderful activity.

Founded by Pandit Madan Mohan Malviya in 1917, Banaras Hindu University is spread in 1,300 acres. Housing new Vishwanath temple built by the Birlas in 1966, the university is the largest residential university in India. Bharat Kala Bhavan, an art museum, is also located inside the university campus. A vast collection of scriptures, miniature paintings, sculptures and old photographs of Varanasi are found in the museum.

Ramnagar Fort was once the royal residence of former Maharaja of Varanasi. Built by Maharaja Balwant Singh, the red sandstone edifice houses a temple dedicated to Veda Vyasa and a museum displaying vintage cars, royal palanquins, swords, guns, antique clocks, etc.

Ashoka Pillar is a prominent site in Sarnath located 10 kms away from Varanasi. Mauryan Emperor Ashoka built it. Sarnath, being the place where Lord Buddha delivered his first sermon post his enlightenment, holds a very important place among Buddhists. Here, one can also visit Stupas, temples and Sarnath museum.

Other Major Attractions in Varanasi are:

  • Aghor Peeth
  • Alamgir Mosque
  • Jantar Mantar
  • Mahatma Gandhi Kashi Vidyapeeth
  • Jain Temple

Varanasi is also renowned for its silk industry. Its street markets namely Chowk and Vishwanath Gali deal in classic Banarasi silk sarees, silk brocades and wide variety of jewellery. Food lovers must have hot kachoris, lassi, sweets, paan and thandai.

How to Reach Varanasi

By Air: The nearest airport is Varanasi Airport connecting the city to all major cities in the world.

By Rail: Varanasi Railway Station is the main railhead.

By Road: There are good network of roads which connect Varanasi to all major cities of Uttar Pradesh. Tourists can take state-run or private buses here. Cabs are also there.

FAQs for Varanasi Tour Packages

Q1: How Much Will A Trip To Varanasi Cost?

Ans:The cost of a trip to Varanasi can vary depending on various factors such as the mode of transportation, accommodation choices, dining preferences, and the duration of your stay. On average, a moderate budget for a trip to Varanasi can range from INR 33,253 to INR 66,506 per person for a week-long trip, including accommodation, food, transportation, and sightseeing expenses. However, it's important to note that these estimates are subjective and can differ based on individual preferences and travel styles.

Q2: How Many Days Are Enough For A Trip To Varanasi?

Ans:The ideal duration for a trip to Varanasi depends on your interests and the amount of time you have available. To experience the main attractions and get a feel for the city's cultural and spiritual heritage, a minimum of two to three days is recommended. This timeframe allows you to explore the famous Ghats, visit important temples like the Kashi Vishwanath Temple, take a boat ride along the Ganges River, and attend the mesmerizing Ganga Aarti ceremony. However, if you have more time, extending your stay to four or five days will provide a more relaxed and immersive experience.

Q3: How To Plan For A Trip To Varanasi?

Ans:Planning a trip to Varanasi involves considering several factors. Here are some steps to help you in planning:

  • Decide on the duration:Determine how many days you can allocate for your Varanasi trip.
  • Research:Gather information about the city's attractions, cultural significance, and local customs. This will help you understand what to expect and make the most of your visit.
  • Book accommodations:Look for hotels or guesthouses in areas that suit your preferences and budget. The popular areas to stay in Varanasi include the vicinity of the Ghats, such as Dashashwamedh Ghat, Assi Ghat, or the nearby Cantonment area.
  • Transportation:Decide on your mode of transportation to reach Varanasi, whether it's by air, train, or road. Book your tickets in advance to secure the best deals.
  • Create an itinerary:Make a list of the attractions you want to visit and plan your days accordingly. Varanasi offers a mix of spiritual, historical, and cultural sites, so prioritize based on your interests.
  • Be mindful of local customs:Varanasi is a sacred city, so it's important to respect local customs and traditions. Learn about appropriate attire, etiquette at temples, and the significance of rituals like the Ganga Aarti.

Q4: Which Area Is Best To Stay In Varanasi?

Ans:The choice of the best area to stay in Varanasi depends on your preferences and interests. Here are a few popular areas:

  • Near the Ghats:Staying near the Ghats, such as Dashashwamedh Ghat or Assi Ghat, offers a more immersive experience. You'll be close to the Ganges River, the main attractions, and the vibrant atmosphere of the city.
  • Cantonment area:The Cantonment area, located near the Varanasi Junction railway station, provides a more modern and convenient stay. It offers a range of accommodation options and is well-connected to other parts of the city.
  • Sarnath:If you're interested in Buddhist heritage, Sarnath is a good option. It is located a few kilometres away from Varanasi and is the place where Gautam Buddha gave his first sermon.

Q5: Which Is The Best Time For A Varanasi Trip?

Ans:The best time to visit Varanasi is during the winter season, from November to February. The weather during this time is pleasant and comfortable for exploring the city. The temperatures range from around 5°C (41°F) to 25°C (77°F). It's important to note that Varanasi can get crowded during festivals and religious events, so if you want a more peaceful visit, it's advisable to avoid major festivals like Diwali and Shivaratri. Additionally, it's recommended to check the weather conditions and any local events or holidays that might affect your travel plans.
